publications.description: This bachelor thesis has two main objectives: first, to know the opinion that Psychologists have about art therapy, and second to assess the importance of art therapy in the treatment of patients with psychological problems. In art therapy, the patient is asked to draw, color, paint, dance, sing, play an instrument or write under certain therapeutical guidelines. To reach the objectifs, a semi-structured interview instrument has been created (Therapy of Art to stimulate Communication). The instrument was answered by 38 psychologists who provided psychological treatments to patients. Based on the results obtained, it is concluded that more than 50% of respondents believe that art therapy helps the patient reduce their stress levels and anxiety, to express thoughts difficult to verbalize, to stimulate imagination and creativity and to improve their motor skills. Because this therapy is not so known in Panama, it is suggested to introduce it into the study program of the Psychology career so that future colleagues have an alternative to work with patients who find it difficult to verbalize their problems.
publications.name: Bachelor Thesis: Descriptive exploratory study about the use of art therapy to stimulate communication in patients with psychological problems
Master thesis: Development of a module for a smartphone app, intended to treat anxiety, depression and chronic pain in older adults
publications.description:
Background: Chronic pain (CP), anxiety, and depression are common health problems that
have few known treatments for the elderly. In this work, a module for a smartphone app has
been developed to decrease those variables in that population. Another part of the work
analyzed the link between the acceptance of chronic pain (ACP) and depression and anxiety
in the database of an ongoing study at the University of Fribourg. Method: 46 participants
with different chronic pain diagnoses were recruited to complete a battery of tests: Chronic
Pain Acceptance Questionnaire (CPAQ), Beck's Depression Inventory (BDI) and Anxiety
Inventory State-Trait Form YB (STAI). Results: A module for a web application was
developed to treat CP, depression and anxiety in the elderly. Apart from that, an analysis
showed a correlation between the total score of the CPAQ with that of the BDI, r (46) = - .36,
p<.05, but not with CPAQ and STAI, r (46)=-. 03 , p<.05. Conclusion: A significative
negative link was found between ADC and depression. Implications: Apps are increasingly
used to manage health issues.
